intro: Oxydectes costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican oxydectes, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
